The idea of ‚Äã‚Äãa digital twin, a virtual representation of an object, a person or processes, is not new. But the application of advanced big data analytics and AI might turn it into a truly disruptive technology. What happens when digital twins are linked to the real world, real people, real processes real time for monitoring and control? ‚úîÔ∏èWill we be in control, or will digital twins control us? ‚úîÔ∏èHow do we interact with digital twins? ‚úîÔ∏èWho will be using the technology and for what purposes? ‚úîÔ∏èWhich companies are the driving forces behind the Digital Twin technology? ‚úîÔ∏èHow can we develop Digital Twins that will make the world a better place? ‚úîÔ∏èHow can we use Digital Twin technology to reach the UN sustainable development goals? "AI can't explain itself. Will Designers Help?" Technology is held to the highest standard. As users we demand technology to be precise, deterministic and transparent. But AI is a different type of technology, and holding AI to the highest standard may be the biggest limitation to its success. AI could help cure hunger, make us healthier, happier and more creative. However, machines won't be able to explain their rationale. Should they? and will designers be able to help? Alvaro Soto, design lead at IBM Watson, will tell you all about this next week the 23rd!
